project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When a board has a great number of Completed Sprints, it becomes very hard to browse through those Sprints while generating reports (Sprint report, for example). The list can get so large that users can't see most recent Sprints unless they shrink their resloution way down, or view it on a bigger monitor. Providing the ability to archive or delete old Sprints would certainly make a good improvement.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to archive completed Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
some of my team work in the UK, some in the US.  We have different public holidays (and people take vacations).  It'd be nice to be able to configure different non-working days for different team members so that the burndown better tracks the expected velocity through the sprint.

Ie. if only 50% of people are working on a given day then the burndown for that day should show 50% of the work rate.
fields.summary: Support configuring different non-working days for different team members

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Initially when we create a sprint, we have stories with remaining estimates that are our best guess for completing the whole story.  Then individual developers break down the tasks into subtasks as they do the back-of-envelope design for the task.

The problem that we have is that when we create subtasks, the parent task also has its own remaining estimate and the two get summed (when really the subtask is just a part of the parent task, not an addition).

At the moment, we manually adjust the parent estimate down when adding a subtask but it'd be easier if we could have a "post action" at creation of the subtask that reduced the parent estimate accordingly.
fields.summary: Add option for subtasks to "steal" time from parent at creation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrade to Jira v6, the top drop down menues does not work after you click into a Agile board (on the attached image [1].
Once you click on the Jira logo (on the attached image our logo [2]  at the top left, the drop down menues work again. But they stop working again nce you are in a Agile board...

See attached image
fields.summary: Drop down menues does not work in Jira 6

Tasks are still showing with strikethrough font but new summary titles are no longer.  This appears to be a JIRA/greenhopper issue so I'm filing here but it may be a JIRA issue
fields.summary: Issues that are closed do not indicate state with strikethrough font

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Unable to select latest versions in Version Report in Scrum Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to your documentation what I describe here has been implemented by design.
When a sprint has ended, stories that haven't been completed go back to the *top of the backlog*. If you have any sprints planned though the top represents the *next planned sprint!!*
According to Scrum basics a story should go back to the backlog once it hasn't been resolved. Regarding agile boards the story should be positioned right after the backlog marker and not the first sprint.

I know that an improvement already exists GHS-6421 but in my opinion (and the customer I represent) zhis should be treated as a bug.
fields.summary: Unresolved issues should be in the backlog not the next planned sprint after a sprint has been ended

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The collapse button on the swimlane ('V' or down-pointing arrow) disappears and have to scroll back u to get it back.

It would be best if the 'collapse' button retained when user scrolling down from their web browser. So that, user will easily view assignee from their swimlane and not having problem when 'collapse' or 'expand' the assignee column.

The problem is reproducible when the following criterias are met:
* The user configure a swimlane based on assignees on a rapidboard.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Configure a swimlane based on assignees on a rapidboard
# Create 10 issues and assign to 2 assignee equally. For example, each assignee get assigned 5 issues
# Create sprint and get assigned 10 issues then start sprint
# Go to work mode and drop open the list of issues for an assignee's issues
# Scroll the main panel downwards
# The following outcome before and after scroll:
!before_scroll.JPG|thumbnail!
!after_scroll.JPG|thumbnail!

*Finding*
* This problem happened in Greenhopper 6.2.1.
* Tested in IE 9, Google Chrome v26 and FF v20.
fields.summary: 'collapse' arrow on rapidboard swimlane disappears when scrolling down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA gives plugin developers the ability to print out warnings if their JQL functions e.g. have a performance impact or return limited results. This works well in the issue navigator (the search gets executed):

!jql_warning_02.png!

However, Greenhopper's quickfilters incorrectly assume that this is an error and do not allow to save the quickfilter even though the JQL syntax is correct (notice the little check mark?):

!jql_warning.png!

This renders us compeltely unable to use any of our JQL functions on the Greenhopper boards, because the way we configured them, they will always print the warning message.
fields.summary: Cannot save quickfilters because they interpret JQL warnings as errors

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This needs to cover wallboards too.

CoS:

# Right click context menu should be available for parent issue swimlane
## The menu only contains one option which is to Add or Remove Flag (depending on state)
## Menu is only opened when right-clicking not on a control inside the swimlane (i.e. not on the issue key, not on the "transition", not on the twixie)
# The option should be available via Cog menu (already present)
# Flagged state needs to be visible in Wallboard Gadget

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: What if the JQL swimlane is defined as a single issue?
A: You can't flag it

Q: Does it work if the swimlane is collapsed/expanded?
A: It still appears as flagged and you can still flag it. 

Q: Does it work in all supported browsers?
A: yes
fields.summary: Flagging on stories as swimlanes in work mode

fields.description:
h3.Scenario 
You can create sprints at a scrum board and after the sprint is over, there may be more steps before the code is released. And this steps can be done at an kanban Rapid Board. Once you click in an issue at an kanban board, there is no information on what sprint it belongs to, as you can see in the attached screenshot, unless you click in the link for the issue that sends you to the issue screen with all the information. 

There should be an option to add a field in the detail screen at the rapid board that can display this information.

!screenshot.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to see the Sprint the issue belongs in the detail view

fields.description:
As can be seen in the image, cog the menu does not really reveal that all of these options are for the *Scrum Board* except the *Create board* point:
!scrum_board.JPG|thumbnail!

This can cause users to  inadvertently delete their *Scrum Board* while deleting unnecessary issues in their projects.

Of course, there is option to choose to use the keyboard shortcut or bulk operations but as users are also provided with the cog menu and that one also can include a "Delete" point, this creates confusion for users.

Suggestion to tackle this matter is to have the board menu items are all written out like *Delete Board*, *Copy Board*, etc. just like the *Create Board*.
fields.summary: Improvement in GreenHopper Scrum Board Cog Menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to be able to mark a "red line" just below the Minimum Marketable Feature set (MMF), in the "plan" tab of Greenhopper (Rapidboard version(s), not the classic one).

While I do communicate to the team what these are, it would be good for them to be able to see where it is without having to ask.

I think it would make sense to place the "red line" in the left-hand Epic column, and be able to drag it around, just like Epics.

Many thanks for any consideration!
fields.summary: Backlog Marker for Minimum Marketable Feature Set

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Both in project specific configuration and global configuration.

A project that had a field which was then removed was not able to be configured again.

To reproduce:
* Create a sample scrum project
* Go to classic mode
* Click Tools > Configuration
* Look at Rank field - no way to add a new one

In test data, e.g. QuickFilters project, there is a field listed. It can be removed, then you get to the same state where you can't add another one.

h3. Cause

As of JIRA 6.0, the class {{CalculatedCFType}}, from which our {{RankCFType}} class extends, is no longer a {{SortableCustomField}}. This causes Classic configuration to not recognise the rank field as a valid option.

h3. Work-around

The Rank field is still able to be used for projects which use the *Scrum Project Template*. If you can alter your project's configuration to use this template instead, then you should be able to use the Rank field.
fields.summary: Classic - cannot configure Rank field for project

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

Given the following situation - In GreenHopper 6.2.1, The Scrum board has Swimlanes configured to use 'Stories', and the issue has at least one sub-task. When the parent issue is resolved, the issue key would not be strikethrough

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Install GreenHopper 6.2.1
# Configure the Swimlanes in the Scrum Board to use 'Stories'
# Create a sprint, an issue (plus a sub-task)
# Insert the issue (that has the sub-task) into the sprint, and start it
# Resolve the sub-task, and resolve the parent issue
# Issue key of sub-task would have strikethrough, but not parent issue

!GH621.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

It seems that if the issue does not have a sub-task, then the strikethrough would appear as usual
fields.summary: Issue key in Work Mode does not get strikethrough when done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Now that we have a live JIRA 6.0 product version on MPAC we have tested installing and obtaining a eval license for GH from the create project dialog when trying to create a *Agile Kanban project*.

The screenshot below shows that we can:

* download the plugin from MPAC
* install the plugin to the local JIRA instance
* prompt the user for their my.atlassian.com credentials

What fails is the login attempt via a REST call to id.atlassian.com.

More info:

* THIS ISSUE ONLY HAPPENS IN FIREFOX.  THE PROCESS COMPLETES SUCCESSFULLY IN CHROME.  I DID NOT TEST SAFARI or IE.
* I have validated my credentials by logging in successfully via the web UI.
* I have has several other people try to login with their credentials and they fail in the same spot in the create project dialog.
* I am running this instance of JIRA on my dev workstation.  I am using the final 6.0 bits from WAC.  I am running JIRA using a valid eval license.
* I am able to obtain a eval license for GH by using the "Try It" button in UPM.  Note that the UPM Try It button does not talk to the same login REST resource as the create project dialog does.  It redirects the user to the my.atlassian.com site.

It is unclear to me whether this is an issue with the id.atlassian.com REST end point or whether it is a problem with the "GH Marketing plugin" in JIRA.  

*Diagnosis so far*
* In FF the ajax request to the login resource at id.atlassian.com has an empty request body.  This is why we are getting back 403 from id.atlassian.com.  the request body is NOT empty in chrome.
fields.summary: Cannot obtain a license for GH when GH is installed via Create Project dialog

fields.description:
When we create custom fields we store their id in the database. The code loading the fields checks for their existence, and if not available we assume the field has been deleted and we recreate it.

The problem is that the CustomFieldManager might tell us a field is not available when in reality it is. Implement an additional db layer check whenever we have a custom field id stored but CFM doesn't return us the field. If we find the relevant entry in the database than throw an Exception instead of recreating the field
fields.summary: Perform database existence checks before recreating custom fields

fields.description:
Tested on a fresh *GreenHopper 6.2.1*. Having sub-task resolved / closed, the parent issue is also set to resolved / closed. The *Plan Mode* shows that it has the strike through. However, on the *Work Mode*, it stays the same.

_Steps to replicate_

* Create a new issue on the *Scrum Board*
!error_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* After that, create a sub-task of the parent issue
!error_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* Create a new Sprint and include the parent issue into it
!error_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* Switch to the *Work* mode and resolve the sub-task
!error_4.JPG|thumbnail!

* After that, the following pop out will ask whether you would like to update the parent issue (Resolve / Close)
!error_5.JPG|thumbnail!

* Proceed to close the parent issue
!error_6.JPG|thumbnail!

* Strike through is present on the *Plan* Mode
!error_7.JPG|thumbnail!

* Missing strike through on the *Work* mode
!error_8.JPG|thumbnail!

This differs from the previous *GreenHopper* behavior. Hope this will be looked at real soon.
fields.summary: Parent Issue is not being struck out after it is resolved / closed (even after the all sub-task issue is resolved / closed) on Work Mode

fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to set start and end date for planned sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Original summary: GreenHopper misuses the concepts of "epics" and "themes"
--

An _epic_ is a placeholder for a collection of user stories that will eventually be defined (this has to happen before they're added to a sprint). Epics can be prioritized in the Product Backlog, along with all the other Product Backlog Items.

A _theme_ is a coherent set of user stories -- Often the resulting user stories from an epic. You can't prioritize a theme per se, because its Product Backlog Items may not necessarily be in a consecutive order.

GreenHopper is mixing the two concepts, leading to the following issues:
# You can't prioritize an epic (the issue type) in the Product Backlog. They don't even show up in the Product Backlog.
# The "epic" functionality is in some aspects confusing and cumbersome, because it mainly deals with themes, while also assuming that epic = theme. One consequence is having a redundant "Epic Status" field that users must somehow keep in sync with the "Status" field. 
# You get a separate pseudo backlog for "epics", which allows you to prioritize them. This doesn't mean anything in Scrum.

Older versions of JIRA/GreenHopper used to get these two things right, albeit with an interface that wasn't as helpful as the new Rapid Boards: Themes were a type of label and epics could be prioritized.
fields.summary: Ability to view and prioritise epics in the backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From the customer:

{quote}
Hi,
I upgraded GH to 6.2.1 and I really like the new look-and-feel!
However, the tiny icons in the Agile menu that indicates the type of board has disappeared.
(see attachment) 
Is this supposed? I have seen in a demo video on your web-page that they should probably be there! 
Most of our teams work with both types of boards and it would be great if they didn't have to indicated board type in the name of the board.
{quote}
fields.summary: Agile menu icons is missing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When refining large stories we need to create smaller stories for which the epic is already known. But when creating or reviewing a story using the card view of the story I cannot directly add it to an epic. I first have to switch to the planning board which means that I loose my context.
fields.summary: As a user I want to add an issue to an epic when displaying the the issue card so that I don't need to open a planning board and loose my work context

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the section "Issues in Epic" displays the issues but as user I cannot quickly change the sort orders of these items (like it is possible for section attachments).

Sorting the issues would be helpful to get quickly an overview of the Epic. I like to do this with as few mouse clicks as possible.
fields.summary: As a user I want to sort the issues in Epic by resolution, status or assignee so that I can quickly view get an overview of the progress in the Epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Issue

Currently the Epic card list has a section "Issues in Epic" but the sorting of those issues cannot be sorted by status or resolution or assignee.

Sorting would be helpful to quickly get an overview of the Epic. So I like to do this with as few mouse clicks as possible.
fields.summary: Add a link from the View Issue page of an Epic which shows the "Issues in Epic" in Issue Navigator

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing an Epic and looking at the "Issues in Epic" section I would like to see the resolution of closed issues.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the resolution of issues when viewing the Epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a rapid board owner, I can create new columns in my work board to model my development process, which is great.

The consequence of this is that an additional status is added to the list of statuses, which I can understand.

When some owner is experimenting with his board configuration, you end up with a long list of statusses such as 'test', 'under test', 'in validation', 'sdfjqsfdmjkl' ...
Note - only users who have 'project admin' permission can create new statuses, but this was a permission only granted to 'jira administrators' in the past.  In our configurations, project admins are not jira admins.

So - request - there must be a way to limit the list of users who should be able to create statuses or columns, or at least notify the user that  a new global entity (status) will be created which will affect the complete instance ...
fields.summary: Ability to define permission to create status via Simplified Workflow

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Update alignments of issue and story swimlane parent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When editing an epic name within GH I am limited to the number of characters I can enter.  However, when I edit an epic name within JIRA I do not have a limitation.  At a minimum I would expect the behavior to be the same in either place.  I would prefer to not be character limited.
fields.summary: Epic name character limit exists in GH but not JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the sprint report, the chart displayed is way too little and it would be a great feature to enlarge the chart.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to view a bigger chart in the Sprint report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful to see a 'burndown chart' for the entire project, not only for a sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to view a burndown chart for the entire project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
With parallel Sprints coming up, a board can contain a ton of ongoing sprints at the same time.  It'd be nice to have a way to hide the Sprint filters, see screenshot:
!Screen_Shot_2013-05-16_at_11.35.06_AM.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include option to hide Sprints in Work Mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently I have to manually add swimlanes by query

{quote}"Epic Link" = __________{quote}

This requires continual maintenance as new epics are added to my project.  It should be simple to create swimlanes by Epic (or as Jira/Greenhopper calls it, "Epic Link").

Apologies if this is a duplicate request; I did not find it in any search results.
fields.summary: As a user/admin, I would like an option to create scrum board swimlanes according to Epic ("Epic Link")

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
we are using values like 3.5 in our story point field and sometimes they appear and sometimes not. So when we edit the story is shows the 3.5.
in the issue the 3.5 is truncated to 3 when displayed. when displayed in the 
Rapid release board it shows 3.5. when it is exported to excel it is a 3. 

this is a major problem for us how can it be fixed? 

I have attached slides showing the different screens 

Janeen
fields.summary: when we have story points with floating points - like 3.5 or the like the value get truncated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As of now, it is the default behavior for the sub-task to inherit the *Fix Version/s* field from the parent issue as we can see from [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6072] and the current workaround is to remove the project from the projects 'Enabled for GreenHopper' in the GreenHopper configuration. You should find it no longer inherits the parent fix version as mentioned by Shaun Clowes. Looking from a different perspective, is it possible to have an option to choose whether this can be optional or not?

Perhaps some sort of of *checkbox* in *GreenHopper* that says something like?
* Inherit *Fix Version/s* from Parent Issue for sub-task (/) (x)
fields.summary: Option to disable / enable Fix Version/s field inheritance from parent ticket when creating sub-task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: "Days remaining in Sprint" in Sprint Health gadget doesn't work for 7 working days

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I've found times where sprints were started accidentally and we need to add stories to the sprint (as part of the commitment) and times where sprints were closed accidentally and we need to close stories before we completed the sprint because the work was done.
fields.summary: As an administrator of a project, I need to be able to edit sprint contents as our velocity doesn't accurately represent the work that was done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are unable to use the version report, because we have hundreds of legacy versions in our system.  When I attempt to select a recent version, there are dozens that come before it, and the pick list widget does not allow me to scroll down to select the right version.
fields.summary: Version pick list is not usable with large number of versions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Previously in Classic Statistic Burndown Gadget, it can be configured to show results for a Project or a Product. If the current Sprint Burndown gadget can be configured to have multiple sprints, it could show the progress of almost a complete product (which is the goal). Perhaps when it is configurable to multiple sprints, it also can be limited to a version.
fields.summary: Burndown Gadget to show multiple sprints or to Version burndown

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When an epic's name includes an ampersand, GreenHopper's planning view displays its label correctly in the backlog but not in the story details pane on the right. See attached screenshot. Presumably this applies to entities in general, not just ampersands...
fields.summary: Epic name display bug in GreenHopper planning view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add confirmation/warning when releasing sub-tasks of parents that are in progress from a Kanban board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user clicks on an issue from a sprint or the backlog, the detail of that issue will be shown on the _Issue Detail View_.  Then, if the user wants to view the issue, he/she will need to click on the issue link from the _Issue Detail View_.  

A configuration to directly view an issue (instead directing to Issue Detail View first) would be convenient for users.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to directly view an issue instead going to the Issue Detail view first on the Plan Mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Replications steps :
1) install HAL instance using fireball-220
2) log in as sysadmin
3) uninstall GH 
4) enable marketing plugin again (actually I'm not sure if this is a separate bug)
5) From within an admin context (e.g. /secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa or the Manage Add-ons page) click Project > Create Project > Agile Scrum > Enable GH
6) A JS is thrown
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Object function (){var G=null;if(arguments.length&&typeof arguments[0]=="string"){G=arguments.callee.$(document.createElement(arguments[0]));if(arguments.length==2){G.html(arguments[1])}}return G} has no method 'parseUri' 
{code}
fields.summary: GH Installation fails in admin context from marketing PT

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Go to plan mode
# Try to re-order an epic

Seen on JAC.
fields.summary: Error 'A rank custom field ID must be specified for this operation' when trying to re-order Epics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Resolved stories no longer show as struck through

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The newest version of GH seems to be missing the footer at the bottom of the page that shows which version of GH and JIRA you're using.
fields.summary: Missing footer that shows version numner

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Scenario: I have a board with multiple statuses represented in one column. Assuming my workflow allows it, today I'm able to drag an item from one column to this other column, and I get multiple "drop zones" where I can put the issue, thereby giving it one of the many statuses represented in that column. 

The desired enhancement is that I can change an issue's status without moving it to a different column. For example, I have a column with "Open" and "Requires Clarification" statuses in it. My workflow allows an issue to go from "Requires Clarification" to "Open". When I select an issue in the "Requires Clarification" status, I'd want to see a drop zone appear in the same column allowing me to drop it into "Open".
fields.summary: As a user, I can change a ticket's status on the board by moving it to a different status within the same column

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like the PDF report contain following information:

1. Sprint start date and end date
2. Sprint stories and their IDs
3. Graph of committed story points and actual for the sprint. l
4. Stories and tasks that are not completed
5. Pie chart of distribution of stories by epics
6. Changes in the sprint - stories added or deleted
7. A bar graph of last 3 or 4 sprint velocity and their duration.

The actual use case is to send such a report to executives when a sprint is concluded as status. One report will help the executives get what is happening in the sprint and if any corrections need to be taken. I see Jira/GH is well positioned to reduce burden on managers handling the project by bringing transparency and consistency in handling the projects. From my experience manager handling a project spends lot of time with communication and setting the stakeholders in sync.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like PDF report export capabilities

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: According to our documentation on [Configuring Swimlanes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Swimlanes], it is possible to base swimlanes on Epics, however, this only applies to version 6.2.1, but the documentation states that is applicable to 6.2.x, which is incorrect. Please add this to the documentation, as customers can be confused.
fields.summary: Swimlanes per Epics is not working as documented

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please allow the ability to manage and view sub-task from the sprint planning mode rapid board view. Sometimes it is required to split up work from a larger project and only account for a portion of the sub-task in a particular sprint. For that reason we need the ability to manage task and sub-task in the planning mode to ensure required issues are not accidentally left behind.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to access sub-tasks in sprint planning mode on rapid board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If we have just one sub-task in the work mode, the area is small and, depending of how we click on the issue to drag it, we can't move it to the right transition.

If I click on the top of the issue:
!top.png!
I can drag it to both transitions in Chrome and only to "Resolve Issue" in Firefox. 



However, if I click on the bottom of it:
!bottom.png!
I can only drag it to the "Close Issue" transition in both browsers.
fields.summary: Drag and drop to a column with multiple statuses is not working properly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The ability to have a history within GH, like on a JIRA ticket, would be helpful and allow for follow up if someone accidentally starts/finishes a sprint or rename the sprint.
fields.summary: Provide history for sprint activities

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Resizable issue details window in GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the Sprint Burndown chart, it is very helpful to know whether the items are added to the Sprint (i.e. scope change) were resolved during the Sprint. 

Unlike other parts of JIRA, the issue key does not change to struckthrough text on the Sprint Burndown chart when the issue has been resolved.
fields.summary: Issue Key should reflect whether issue is resolved in Reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, there is no method to include any form of notes in GreenHopper. This could come in useful, especially for situations where users would like to keep some notes regarding their sprints (for example, focus areas. estimations, what went well, what needs improvements, etc).
fields.summary: Allow insertion of notes into GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In order to determine which Epic a story belongs to in GreenHopper Reports, you would have to go into the issue itself. 

It's helpful if Epic name is specified in the report too, for every story.
fields.summary: Show Epic name that a story belongs to in JIRA Software Reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you try to print any GreenHopper report (Sprint report, burndown chart, Version report etc.), and the number of issues in that report overflows one single printed page, the following problems occur based on the browser you are using:

*GOOGLE CHROME*
# Access the print dialog via *Right Click + Print*. 
# Notice that the GreenHopper report shown in the Print Preview is truncated, with scroll bars: [^TruncatedReport_GC.jpg]

*FIREFOX*
# Access the print preview dialog via *File > Print Preview*.
# The report is also truncated, but without the scroll bars: [^TruncatedReport_FF.jpg]

Note that the reports used in the screenshots above should show 28 issues in total, but they are truncated.

Additional information:
# Tested on the latest Firefox and latest Chrome.
# Happens in GH 6.2.1
# Does not happen in GH 6.2
fields.summary: GreenHopper Report page is truncated when printing via Browser print dialog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the new look and feel introduced in 6.2.1 version, is more difficult to scroll page with ipad in plan mode and work mode, that in previous versions.
fields.summary: New look and feel broken Ipad Usability

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. set GH configuration to only be enabled for a single project
2. Remove browse permission for that project for the current user (or all users)

Result: when clicking the Agile tab, the user is redirected to the Welcome page every time instead of going to their previous board. 

This is because we first check to see if the user has permission for any of the GH enabled projects (Classic!!) and if they don't we redirect to getting started. 

The fix is to do this check later on and let them try to go to a Rapid board if they have one stored.
fields.summary: Permission checking in GreenHopper.jspa is too aggressive

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if, instead of click in each parent issue in work mode on GreenHopper to check their status, we can view it in a column beside the issue. Today we have a column for the Issue Key, one showing how many sub-tasks it has and another showing the issue summary. We can have one before the issue summary showing the issue status.
fields.summary: Option to have a visual way to quickly view the parent issue status in Work Mode
